page.title: 13 Rambridge Farm.
page.content:
The largest{farm}in the block has its own{cottages}and is chiefly given over to arable{crops. }There is some{sheep farming and paddocks for{horses,}and some fields are under vegetable crops. { Rambridge Park}still comprises open ground with stately trees and has an air of wealth which still lingers from its original planning.
Many livelihoods depended on larger estates such as these and although the support has disappeared the evidence of the crafts still remains. Hedgerows no longer layered but still used as boundaries and{thatch}for walling as well as houses are two examples.
